Authors:
Ishani Dilhara Goonasekara, Ruvishika Shehali Jayawardena,
Natsaran Saichana
Title:
New records of two appendage bearing ceolomycetes on grasses
in Thailand
Keywords:
multi-gene analysis, Poaceae, saprobes, Sordariomycetes,
taxonomy
Abstract:
Grasses are agriculturally, economically and ecologically
dominant among plants. Their fungal diversity is more fascinating but
has been relatively poorly studied or restricted to a few important
hosts or pathogens. Therefore, numerous grass inhabiting fungal species
are awaiting discovery or re-study based on morphology and molecular
phylogeny. In an ongoing study of grasses inhabiting fungi in Thailand,
two interesting saprobic members of Sodariomycetes were collected. Based
on morphology, coupled with combined gene analyses of LSU and ITS
sequence data, they were identified as Dinemasporium pseudostrigosum and
Robillarda africana belonging to Chaetosphaeriaceae and Sporocadaceae,
respectively. This is the first report of the two species for Thailand
as well as the first record of R. africana occurring on grasses. The
newly collected species are compared to other related species and
comprehensive descriptions and photo-micrographs are provided.
